Detailed Description

Shader is the based class for objects that return horizontal spans of colors during drawing.

A subclass of Shader is installed in a Paint calling paint.setShader(shader). After that any object (other than a bitmap) that is drawn with that paint will get its color(s) from the shader. 

 //Example: Use Shader's child class - SweepGradient to draw a circle with weep gradient on canvas.
 //create colors/positions array and also the base class - Shader
        Shader *shader;
        gaia::base::Array<uint32_t> colorArray(3);
        gaia::base::Array<float> posArray(3);
 // assign colors to colorArray
        colorArray[0] = Color::RED; colorArray[1] = Color::GREEN; colorArray[2] = Color::BLUE;
 // assign positions to posArray
        posArray[0] = 0.2; posArray[1] = 0.3; posArray[2] = 0.5;

 //test for SweepGradient
        shader = new SweepGradient(50.0f, 150.0f, colorArray, posArray);
 //set sweep gradient as Shader for paint.
        paint.setShader(shader);
 //draw circle on canvas
        canvas->drawCircle(50.0f, 150.0f, 50.0f, paint);

Definition at line 37 of file Shader.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::graphics::Shader::TileMode

Define how shader reacts on target object.

Enumerator:
CLAMP 

replicate the edge color if the shader draws outside of its original bounds

REPEAT 

repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically, alternating mirror images so that adjacent images always seam

MIRROR 

repeat the shader's image horizontally and vertically
